p: Transmitted by the Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopticus mosquitoes, DENV comprises of four antigenically related but distinct serotypes, DEN-1 to -4. According to the World Health Organization, dengue virus (DENV) is considered to be the most widespread arbovirus worldwide, with the disease endemic in more than 100 countries [ 24]. Of the 96 million cases of DENV infections that occur annually, 70% of the disease burden is contributed by Asia alone, followed by Latin America and Africa [ 25]. As the vast majority of cases are asymptomatic or mild, the actual numbers of dengue cases could be under-reported [ 26]. Symptoms of dengue infection include high fever (40 °C), severe headache, retro-orbital pain, and muscle and joint pain. In rare cases, severe dengue may occur with serious manifestations—including capillary leakage, fluid accumulation in tissue spaces, severe bleeding, and organ impairment—which can be potentially fatal [ 27]. Young children in particular are at greater risk of severe dengue as they may be less able to compensate for capillary leakage than adults [ 2].
